Data.event_text: 12 January  2024 Pingdingshan mining explosion Ten people are killed and six others are missing after an explosion at a coal mine in Pingdingshan, Henan.

links.text: -"At least 10 killed in China mining accident". Al Jazeera. Retrieved 2024-01-13.-

Data.event_text: 20 January  Yingcai Boarding School fire Thirteen third grade children are killed and another is injured in a boarding school dormitory fire in Dushu, Henan Province. The school's director is arrested.

links.text: -"13 students dead in China school fire: State media". CNA. Retrieved 2024-01-20.-

Data.event_text: 22 January  A landslide in Zhaotong, Yunnan, kills 44 people.

links.text: -"Remaining landslide victims found in China, bringing death toll to 44". Associated Press. 2024-01-25. Retrieved 12 March 2024.-

Data.event_text: 23 January  2024 Uqturpan earthquake A magnitude 7.1 earthquake strikes Uqturpan County in Xinjiang Province, killing three people, all in Xinjiang, and injuring at least 50 people, the majority of whom are in nearby Kazakhstan. Forty-seven buildings in China collapse, while a further 78 are damaged.

links.text: -"At least 50 injured in major earthquake on China-Kyrgyzstan border". CNA. Retrieved 2024-01-23.-

-"7.1 magnitude quake rattles western China, killing at least 3 people and collapsing 47 homes". Associated Press. 23 January 2024. Archived from the original on 23 January 2024. Retrieved 23 January 2024.-

-"7.1 magnitude quake rattles western China, killing at least 3 people and collapsing 47 homes". Associated Press. 23 January 2024. Archived from the original on 23 January 2024. Retrieved 23 January 2024.-

Data.event_text: 24 January  Thirty-nine people are killed and nine others injured during a fire at a commercial building in Yushui, Jiangxi.

links.text: -"A fire in China's Jiangxi province kills at least 39 people, state media says". AP News. 2024-01-24. Retrieved 2024-01-24.-

Data.event_text: 10 February  Ju County attack An alleged mass murder occurs in Ju County, Shandong, resulting in the deaths of at least 21 people.

links.text: -"中國山東傳大型滅門慘案！村民：21人被殺包括1醫生2公安2嫌在逃". Yahoo News (in Chinese). 2024-02-13. Retrieved 2024-04-05.-

Data.event_text: 22 February  2024 Lixinsha Bridge collapse Five people are killed when a ship rams the Lixinsha Bridge in Guangzhou.

links.text: -"Ship crash causes bridge collapse in China". Al Jazeera. Retrieved 2024-02-22.-

Data.event_text: 24 February  2024 Nanjing building fire A fire at an apartment block in Nanjing kills 15 people.

links.text: -"Apartment block fire in China's Nanjing city kills at least 15, officials say". The Guardian. 2024-02-24. ISSN 0261-3077. Retrieved 2024-02-24.-
-"Apartment block fire in China's Nanjing city kills at least 15, officials say". The Guardian. 2024-02-24. ISSN 0261-3077. Retrieved 2024-02-24.-

Data.event_text: 28 February  China urges the world's largest nuclear states to negotiate a 'no-first-use' treaty.

links.text: -"China urges largest nuclear states to negotiate a 'no-first-use' treaty". Reuters. February 28, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 11 March  Seven miners are killed and 24 others are injured in an explosion inside a coal mine in Anhui.

links.text: -"Seven people die, 2 missing after blast in coal mine in Eastern China". The Sun. 2024-03-12. Retrieved 2024-03-14.-

Data.event_text: 13 March  Two people are killed and 26 others are injured during an explosion caused by a suspected gas leak at a restaurant in Langfang.

links.text: -严茂强. "2 dead, 26 injured in Hebei eatery explosion". www.chinadaily.com.cn. Retrieved 2024-03-13.-

Data.event_text: 19 March  Founder of Chinese property developer Evergrande Group Hui Ka Yan is fined 47 million yuan (US$6.53 million) and barred from the securities market for life after China Securities Regulatory Commission accused the group for inflating its revenue.

links.text: -"China Evergrande's flagship unit, founder punished for securities fraud". Reuters. March 18, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 20 March  Linfen highway accident A bus crashes into a tunnel wall along the HohhotBeihai Expressway in Linfen, Shanxi province, killing 14 people and injuring 37.

links.text: -"A bus crashes into a tunnel wall in northern China, killing 14 people". AP News. March 20, 2024. Retrieved 2024-03-20.-

Data.event_text: 13 April  Twelve people are killed after a tourist boat sinks near Qinhuangdao, Hebei.

links.text: -"China detains 2 over tourist boat capsizing that killed 12, citing lack of safety equipment". Associated Press. April 14, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 22 April  Heavy rain triggers flooding in Guangdong Province, causing around 10 deaths and 110,000 evacuations.

links.text: -"Guangdong: Tens of thousands evacuated from massive China floods". BBC. 22 April 2024. Retrieved 2024-04-22.-

Data.event_text: 27 April  Five people are killed and 140 buildings are damaged after a tornado strikes Guangzhou.

links.text: -"A tornado in southern China kills 5 people and damages factories in the metropolis of Guangzhou". Associated Press. April 28, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 1 May  At least 48 people are killed after a mountainside section of highway in Meizhou, Guangdong Province collapses during heavy rains.

links.text: -"Death toll jumps to at least 48 as a search continues in southern China highway collapse". Associated Press. May 2, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 3 May  China launches the Chang'e 6 spacecraft on a two-month mission to collect lunar rock and soil samples from the far side of the Moon.

links.text: -"China launches historic mission to retrieve samples from far side of the moon". Reuters. May 3, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 7 May  Two people are killed and 21 others are injured in a mass stabbing inside a hospital in Zhenxiong, Yunnan Province.

links.text: -"China: At least two dead, 21 injured in hospital stabbing". BBC. May 7, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 9 May  Nine people are killed and two others are injured in collision between a truck and a passenger van near Qingtongxia, Ningxia.

links.text: -"Crash between truck and passenger van in China's Ningxia region kills 9 people". Associated Press. May 9, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 14 May  United States President Joe Biden passes tariff increases on Chinese imports, including electric vehicle batteries, computer chips, and medical products.

links.text: -"Biden sharply hikes US tariffs on an array of Chinese imports". Reuters. May 14, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 16 May  Russian President Vladimir Putin meets President Xi Jinping in Beijing as part of his two-day visit to China. A joint statement released outlines their countries’ alignment on issues including energy, trade, security, and geopolitics

links.text: -McCarthy, Simone (2024-05-15). "Putin gets red carpet welcome from Xi in China". CNN. Retrieved 2024-05-16.-

Data.event_text: An investigation is opened into Agriculture minister Tang Renjian for suspected corruption-related violations.

links.text: -"China probes agriculture minister for suspected disciplinary violations". Reuters. 2024-05-18. Retrieved 2024-05-18.-

Data.event_text: The Great Wall Marathon returns after a four-year suspension due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

links.text: -"China's Great Wall Marathon returns after four-year suspension due to COVID-19 pandemic". Associated Press. 2024-05-18. Retrieved 2024-05-18.-

Data.event_text: 20 May  Two people are killed and ten others are injured in a mass stabbing at a primary school in Guixi, Jiangxi Province.

links.text: -"China: Knife attack in Guixi city primary school leaves two dead". BBC. 2024-05-20. Retrieved 2024-05-20.-

Data.event_text: 22 May  The United Nations Security Council votes against a resolution introduced by Russia and China banning member states from placing weapons in outer space.

links.text: -Brett Tingley (2024-05-22). "Russian space weapon ban shot down by UN Security Council". Space.com. Retrieved 2024-05-22.-

Data.event_text: 23 May  One person is killed and three others are injured in a suspected gas explosion inside an apartment in Harbin.

links.text: -"An explosion at an apartment building in Harbin, China, kills at least 1 and injures 3". Associated Press. 2024-05-23. Retrieved 2024-05-23.-

Data.event_text: 24 May  Black Dog, a Chinese film directed by Guan Hu, wins the Un Certain Regard prize for international films at the 2024 Cannes Film Festival.

links.text: -"'Black Dog' wins Un Certain Regard competition at Cannes". Reuters. May 24, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 27 May  Four people are killed after an apartment building collapses in Tongling, Anhui.

links.text: -"At least 4 killed and 1 injured in building collapse in eastern China, state media says". Associated Press. 2024-05-28. Retrieved 2024-05-28.-

Data.event_text: 2 June  China's Chang'e 6 lunar exploration mission successfully lands on the far side of the Moon.

links.text: -"China lands on moon's far side in historic sample-retrieval mission". Reuters. June 2, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 3 June  The Ministry of State Security foils an espionage plot involving two government employees accused of working for British intelligence.

links.text: -"Beijing accuses 2 Chinese citizens of being British spies in latest test of relations". Associated Press. June 3, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 4 June  The Chang'e 6 spacecraft lifts off from the surface of the far side of the Moon carrying samples of lunar soil and rocks back to Earth.

links.text: -"Carrying lunar rocks, Chinese probe lifts off from far side of moon". Reuters. June 4, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 10 June  Four American university teachers are injured in a stabbing at a park in Jilin Province.

links.text: -"Four US college instructors stabbed in public park in China". BBC. June 11, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 12 June  Three people are reported missing following a helicopter crash in Shangrao, Jiangxi Province.

links.text: -"A helicopter has crashed with 3 on board in southeastern China". Associated Press. June 12, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 15 June  China issues new regulations allowing the China Coast Guard to detain foreigners accused of entering China's territorial waters and adjacent waters illegally.

links.text: -"China seeks detention of foreigners in disputed South China Sea". Al Jazeera. Retrieved 2024-06-15.-

Data.event_text: 1621 June  At least 47 people die after record rains hit parts of Guangdong Province.

links.text: -"Death toll from southern China floods reaches 47". Al Jazeera. Retrieved 2024-06-21.-

Data.event_text: At least nine people are killed and 15 are reported missing in landslides caused by floods in the provinces of Guangdong and Fujian. At least 378 houses are destroyed while 880 hectares of land is inundated.

links.text: -"Southern China faces heavy floods, and landslides kill at least 9". AP News. 2024-06-18. Retrieved 2024-06-18.-

Data.event_text: Ecuador's foreign ministry announces the reinstatement of visa requirements for travelers from China, citing an increase in irregular migratory flows from the latter.

links.text: -"Ecuador reinstates visa requirement for Chinese travelers". Reuters. June 18, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 21 June  China officially defines Taiwanese separatist behavior as a criminal act.

links.text: -Hille, Kathrin (2024-06-21). "China threatens death penalty for Taiwan 'separatists'". Financial Times. Retrieved 2024-06-22.-

Data.event_text: 22 June  Six people are found dead following a landslide in Shanghang County, Fujian.

links.text: -"Rescuers find family of 6 dead in landslide in eastern China, as severe weather warning extended". Associated Press. 2024-06-22. Retrieved 2024-06-24.-

Data.event_text: 24 June  Three people, including two Japanese nationals, are injured in a stabbing at a bus stop in Suzhou.

links.text: -"Knife attack at a school bus stop in China wounds three, including a Japanese mother and child". Associated Press. 2024-06-25. Retrieved 2024-06-25.-

Data.event_text: 25 June   The Chang'e 6 lunar exploration mission successfully returns to Earth after taking rock and soil samples from the far side of the moon. The Orbiter proceeded on a mission to carry out observations at Sun-Earth Lagrange point L2 after dropping the sample off to Earth.

links.text: -"A Chinese lunar probe returns to Earth with the world's first samples from the far side of the moon". AP News. 2024-06-25. Retrieved 2024-06-25.-
-Jones, Andrew (2024-09-10). "Chang'e-6 orbiter turns up at Sun-Earth Lagrange point after moon sampling mission". SpaceNews. Retrieved 2024-09-10.-

Data.event_text: 27 June  Former defence ministers Li Shangfu and Wei Fenghe are expelled from the Chinese Communist Party for "serious violation of party discipline and the law".

links.text: -"China's Communist Party expels ex-defence ministers over corruption charges". Al Jazeera. 2024-06-27. Retrieved 2024-06-27.-

Data.event_text: 30 June  The privately-owned Tianlong-3 space rocket is destroyed after it is launched by accident from its test site near Gongyi, Henan.

links.text: -"Chinese space rocket crashes in flames after accidental launch". The Guardian. 1 July 2024. Retrieved 1 July 2024.-

Data.event_text: Around 240,000 people are displaced by floods in eastern China.

links.text: -"240,000 people evacuated in China rainstorms". France 24. July 2, 2024.-

Data.event_text: The United States Department of Homeland Security deports 116 Chinese migrants back to China to deter illegal migration across the MexicoUnited States border, representing the nation's first "large charter flight" deportation in the past five years.

links.text: -"US deports 116 Chinese migrants in first 'large' flight in 5 years". AP News. 2024-07-02. Retrieved 2024-07-03.-

Data.event_text: The European Union imposes tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles ranging up to 37.6%, prompting the Ministry of Commerce to investigate European pork and brandy imports as potential retaliatory tariffs.

links.text: -"China reveals next steps in EU brandy probe as EV tariffs take effect". Reuters. July 5, 2024.-

Data.event_text: Five people are killed and 83 others are injured after tornadoes strike Heze, Shandong.

links.text: -"Tornadoes kill 5, injure 83 in China's eastern Shandong province". Associated Press. July 6, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 8 July  Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orbán makes an unannounced "peace mission" to Beijing to meet with Xi Jinping following a similarly unannounced meeting with Russian President Vladimir Putin in Moscow.

links.text: -"China's Xi calls on world powers to help Russia and Ukraine resume direct dialogue". The Hill. July 8, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 10 July  All 32 NATO member states approve an official statement classifying China as a “decisive enabler” of Russia's invasion of Ukraine due to its "no-limits" economic and political partnership with Russia.

links.text: -"NATO allies call China a 'decisive enabler' of Russia's war in Ukraine". AP News. 2024-07-10. Retrieved 2024-07-11.-

Data.event_text: 11 July  Taiwan reports that 66 Chinese military aircraft operated around Taiwanese airspace in a 24-hour period, marking the highest single-day number in 2024 so far.

links.text: -"Taiwan sees single-day record of Chinese planes in airspace". dw.com. Retrieved 2024-07-11.-

Data.event_text: 14 July  The navies of Russia and China begin joint military drills in Guangdong four days after China was called a "decisive enabler" of Russia's invasion of Ukraine in a declaration signed by all 32 NATO countries.

links.text: -"China, Russia start joint naval drills, days after NATO allies called Beijing a Ukraine war enabler". AP News. 2024-07-14. Retrieved 2024-07-14.-

Data.event_text: 15 July  Several Palestinian factions, including Fatah and Hamas, schedule reconciliatory meetings in China in an attempt to end their ongoing political disputes.

links.text: -"Palestinian factions, including Hamas and Fatah, to meet in China in July". Reuters. July 15, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 16 July  Chinese businessman Guo Wengui is found guilty by a U.S. jury on multiple fraud charges, accused of running a racketeering enterprise from 2018 to 2023 that defrauded thousands of investors out of over $1 billion.

links.text: -Larry Neumeister (2024-07-16). "Chinese business tycoon convicted of defrauding followers in $1bn scheme". The Guardian. ISSN 0261-3077. Retrieved 2024-07-17.-
-Larry Neumeister (2024-07-16). "Chinese business tycoon convicted of defrauding followers in $1bn scheme". The Guardian. ISSN 0261-3077. Retrieved 2024-07-17.-

Data.event_text: Sixteen people are killed in a fire at a shopping centre in Zigong, Sichuan.

links.text: -"A fire kills 16 people at a shopping mall in southwestern China". Associated Press. 2024-07-17. Retrieved 2024-07-18.-

Data.event_text: China suspends negotiations between the United States regarding nuclear non-proliferation and arms control, citing American military support for Taiwan.

links.text: -"China halts nuclear arms talks with US over Taiwan support". Al Jazeera. 2024-07-18. Retrieved 2024-07-18.-

Data.event_text: 19 July  At least 38 people are killed and 24 are reported missing after a bridge collapses in Shangluo, Shaanxi following flash flooding.

links.text: -"Death toll from bridge collapse in China's Shaanxi province raised to 38. Two dozen still missing". Associated Press. 3 August 2024. Retrieved 3 August 2024.-

Data.event_text: 21 July  The Philippines announces an agreement with China on resupply missions to the beached naval ship BRP Sierra Madre on Second Thomas Shoal in the South China Sea following an incident in June.

links.text: -"China and Philippines reach tentative deal to defuse tensions at South China Sea flashpoint". The Guardian. 2024-07-22. ISSN 0261-3077. Retrieved 2024-07-22.-
-"China and Philippines reach tentative deal to defuse tensions at South China Sea flashpoint". The Guardian. 2024-07-22. ISSN 0261-3077. Retrieved 2024-07-22.-

Data.event_text: 23 July  2024 Beijing Declaration Various factions in the Palestinian government, including rivals Fatah and Hamas, sign a declaration in Beijing to end their divisions and form a unity government.

links.text: -"Palestinian factions agree to form unity government". Reuters. July 23, 2024.-

Data.event_text: The Badain Jaran Desert is designated as a World Heritage Site by UNESCO.

links.text: -"India's moidam royal burial mounds are its latest World Heritage Site". Associated Press. July 26, 2024.-

Data.event_text: China and India agree to cooperate in withdrawing all their troops from their disputed border, with aims of peacefully achieving "complete disengagement" from the border conflict as quickly as possible.

links.text: -"India and China agree to work urgently to achieve the withdrawal of troops on their disputed border". AP News. 2024-07-26. Retrieved 2024-07-27.-

Data.event_text: 27 July  Eight pedestrians are killed and five others are injured after being hit by a car in Changsha. A suspect is arrested.

links.text: -"Chinese police say 8 people died after a vehicle hit pedestrians in the city of Changsha". AP News. July 27, 2024. Retrieved 2024-07-27.-

Data.event_text: 30 July  An agreement is reached between China and Taiwan to repatriate the fatalities of the 2024 Kinmen Chinese motorboat capsizing incident to the mainland.

links.text: -Ng, Kelly (28 July 2024). "Taiwan and China reach deal over fishermen's deaths". BBC. Retrieved 28 July 2024.-

Data.event_text: At least 30 people are killed and 35 others are reported missing following days of flooding caused in part by Typhoon Gaemi in Zixing, Hunan Province.

links.text: -"Death toll jumps to 30, with 35 others missing, in an area hit by heavy rains in southeastern China". Associated Press. August 1, 2024.-

Data.event_text: China and India conduct the 30th round of talks in New Delhi, India, to resolve the ongoing border disputes, by agreeing to speed up negotiations over the border disputes and to maintain peace and tranquility in border regions.

links.text: -"China, India agree to speed up border negotiations at 30th round of talks". South China Morning Post. 2024-08-01. Retrieved 2024-08-01.-

Data.event_text: 9 August  Multiple funeral directors are charged with selling 4,000 corpses for decades to two major medical companies that are subsidiaries of a state-owned company. The scandal is censored domestically.

links.text: -"Lijkenschandaal in China, duizenden lichamen verkocht aan medische sector". nos.nl (in Dutch). 2024-08-09. Retrieved 2024-08-09.-

Data.event_text: The China Coast Guard claims that two vessels of the Philippine Coast Guard "deliberately collided" with one of its boats in Sabina Shoal in the Spratly Islands.

links.text: -"China accuses the Philippines of deliberately crashing one of its ships into a Chinese vessel". Associated Press. August 19, 2024.-

Data.event_text: President of Vietnam and General Secretary of the Communist Party of Vietnam Tô Lâm arrives in China for a three-day state visit, his first overseas visit since becoming president and general secretary.

links.text: -"Courting spurned neighbour tops Beijing's agenda from visit of Vietnam's Communist Party chief, say analysts". CNA. Retrieved 2024-08-19.-

Data.event_text: 22 August  Belarus and China agree to greatly strengthen mutual trade, financial, energy, and security cooperation, which includes enhancing industrial supply chains and collaboration with the Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macau Greater Bay Area.

links.text: -"China, Belarus agree to strengthen cooperation in trade, security". Reuters. August 22, 2024.-

Data.event_text: At least 11 people are killed and 14 others are reported missing following days of flooding caused by heavy rains in Huludao, Liaoning.

links.text: -"Heavy rainstorms killed 11 people and left 14 others missing in northeastern Chinese city". Associated Press. August 24, 2024.-

Data.event_text: The United States Treasury Department imposes sanctions on more than 400 individuals and entities, including Chinese firms that are allegedly aiding Russia in order to avoid western sanctions.

links.text: -Waldenberg, Jennifer Hansler, Nikki Carvajal, Samantha (2024-08-23). "US unveils major tranche of sanctions targeting Russia". CNN. Retrieved 2024-08-24.{{cite web}}:  CS1 maint: multiple names: authors list (link)-

Data.event_text: A school bus rams into a crowd after its driver loses control over the vehicle outside a school in Tai'an, Shandong Province, killing 11 people and injuring at least 12 others.

links.text: -"School bus ploughs into crowd in China killing 11". BBC. September 3, 2024.-

Data.event_text: Artist Gao Zhen is detained for recurring works critical of former leader Mao Zedong.

links.text: -"Gao Zhen: Chinese artist detained for 'insulting' Mao sculptures". BBC. 3 September 2024. Retrieved 2024-09-03.-

Data.event_text: 5 September  The government bans the adoption of Chinese children to overseas recipients except for those biologically or legally related to adoptees.

links.text: -"China halts foreign adoptions of its children". Associated Press. September 5, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 6 September  The world's largest indoor skiing resort is opened in Pudong, Shanghai, with a 90,000 square metres (970,000 sq ft) skiing area and a total campus area of 350,000 square metres (3,800,000 sq ft).

links.text: -"China: World's largest indoor ski resort opens in Shanghai". dw.com. Retrieved 2024-09-07.-

Data.event_text: 10 September  The Chinese Football Association issues lifetime bans on 43 players and officials following a two-year investigation into match-fixing, bribery and illegal gambling in domestic games.

links.text: -"China's Football Association bans 43 people for life after corruption investigation". Associated Press. 10 September 2024. Retrieved 2024-09-10.-

Data.event_text: 13 September  The National People's Congress approves the raising of the statutory retirement age starting in 2025.

links.text: -"China raises retirement age for first time since 1950s". BBC. 13 September 2024. Retrieved 2024-09-13.-

Data.event_text: 16 September  At least two people are killed after Typhoon Bebinca makes landfall in Shanghai.

links.text: -"2 people reported dead in China as Typhoon Bebinca is downgraded to a tropical storm". Associated Press. 2024-09-17. Retrieved 2024-09-17.-

Data.event_text: 18 September  A ten-year old student of a Japanese school dies in a knife attack in Shenzhen. The suspect is arrested.

links.text: -"A Japanese student stabbed near his school in China has died, Japanese officials say". Associated Press. 2024-09-19. Retrieved 2024-09-19.-

Data.event_text: China carries out its first test of an intercontinental ballistic missile since 1980, launching a dummy warhead into the Pacific Ocean that lands near the Marquesas Islands.

links.text: -"China test-fires ICBM for first time in decades". BBC. 2024-09-25. Retrieved 2024-09-25.-
-"China insists nuclear stance defensive after 'routine' ICBM launch". France 24. 2024-09-26. Retrieved 2024-09-26.-

Data.event_text: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy accuses Brazil and China of using their proposed peace plan for ending the RussoUkrainian War to boost their geopolitical power "at Ukraine's expense" by urging developing nations to agree to it.

links.text: -"Zelenskiy takes aim at China, Brazil push for peace in Ukraine". Reuters. September 25, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 26 September  A United States defence official claims that a Chinese nuclear attack submarine, the first of the new Zhou-class, sank during construction likely between May and June.

links.text: -"New Chinese nuclear attack submarine sank during construction, US official says". ABC News. Retrieved 2024-09-26.-

Data.event_text: 30 September  Three people are killed and 18 others are injured in knife attack at a supermarket in Shanghai. The suspect is arrested.

links.text: -"Knife attack in Shanghai supermarket kills 3, injures 15 others". Associated Press. 2024-10-01. Retrieved 2024-10-01.-

Data.event_text: 11 October  A National Geographic team announces the discovery in the Rongbuk Glacier of the partial remains of British climber Andrew Irvine, who disappeared while climbing Mount Everest in 1924.

links.text: -Wong, Tessa (11 October 2024). "Family tells of 'relief' after 1924 climber's foot found on Everest". BBC News. Retrieved 11 October 2024.-

Data.event_text: 21 October  India announces an agreement with China regarding military patrols along the Line of Actual Control between their countries.

links.text: -"India says it reached deal with China on army patrols along disputed border". Al Jazeera. 21 October 2024.-

Data.event_text: 22 October  The government agrees to extend its 2018 provisional agreement with the Holy See regarding the appointment of Catholic bishops in China until 2028.

links.text: -"China and the Vatican agree to extend an agreement on appointing bishops". Associated Press. 22 October 2024.-

Data.event_text: 28 October  Five people are injured in a knife attack in Haidian, Beijing. The suspect is arrested.

links.text: -"5 people stabbed in Beijing, man detained". Kyodo News. 28 October 2024.-

Data.event_text: 7 November  Leon Wang, the president of AstraZeneca in China, is arrested following allegations of collection of patient data and the importation of medicines not approved by Chinese authorities.

links.text: -"Pharma giant AstraZeneca says China chief detained". France 24. 7 November 2024. Retrieved 7 November 2024.-

Data.event_text: 8 November  The government passes a law on energy aimed to promote carbon neutrality.

links.text: -"China passes energy law to 'promote carbon neutrality'". France 24. 8 November 2024. Retrieved 8 November 2024.-

Data.event_text: 10 November  The foreign ministry issues baselines around Scarborough Shoal that is also claimed by the Philippines.

links.text: -"China delimits a contested South China Sea shoal in a dispute with Philippines". Associated Press. 11 November 2024. Retrieved 11 November 2024.-

Data.event_text: 11 November  At least 35 people are killed and 43 others are injured after a man rams an SUV into a crowd exercising at a sports stadium in Zhuhai.

links.text: -"Dozens killed after car ploughs into crowd in China". BBC. 12 November 2024. Retrieved 12 November 2024.-

Data.event_text: 16 November  Eight people are killed and 17 others are injured in a a mass stabbing carried out by a former student at the a vocational school in Wuxi.

links.text: -Jiang, Steven (16 November 2024). "Eight killed and 17 injured in mass stabbing in eastern China". CNN. Retrieved 2024-11-16.-

Data.event_text: 19 November  An unspecified number of casualties are reported after a car rams into a crowd outside a school in Dingcheng District, Hunan.

links.text: -"Car driven into crowd outside China primary school". BBC. 19 November 2024. Retrieved 2024-11-19.-

Data.event_text: 27 November  Three American nationals imprisoned in China are released and returned to the US as part of a prisoner exchange in return for the release of at least one Chinese national detained in the US.

links.text: -"Three Americans released in US-China prisoner exchange". BBC. 27 November 2024. Retrieved 2024-11-28.-

Data.event_text: 28 November  Miao Hua, an admiral and concurrent member of the Central Military Commission, is suspended from his latter position as part of an investigation into suspected corruption.

links.text: -"China probes top military official for corruption". France 24. 28 November 2024. Retrieved 2024-11-28.-

Data.event_text: 29 November  Dong Yuyu, a journalist working for Guangming Daily, is sentenced to seven years' imprisonment for espionage.

links.text: -"China sentences journalist to jail on spy charges". BBC. 30 November 2024. Retrieved 2024-11-30.-

Data.event_text: 3 December  The Ministry of Commerce imposes a ban on the export of gallium, germanium, antimony and other materials with potential military applications to the United States in retaliation for export controls imposed by Washington on semiconductor-related items.

links.text: -"China bans exports to US of gallium, germanium, antimony in response to chip sanctions". Associated Press. 3 December 2024. Retrieved 3 December 2024.-

Data.event_text: 4 December  A section for the ShenzhenZhanjiang high-speed railway that is under construction collapses in Shenzhen, leaving 13 workers missing.

links.text: -"Rescuers search for 13 workers missing after a railroad construction site collapses in south China". Associated Press. 5 December 2024. Retrieved 5 December 2024.-

Data.event_text: 10 December  Former Evergrande Group chair Tang Shuangning is convicted by a court in Taiyuan of embezzlement and bribery and is sentenced to 12 years' imprisonment.

links.text: -"Former chairman of state-owned bank China Everbright Group jailed for 12 years for corruption". Associated Press. 10 December 2024. Retrieved 10 December 2024.-

Data.event_text: 13 December  Former China national football team coach Li Tie is convicted of match-fixing and bribery and is sentenced to 20 years' imprisonment.

links.text: -"China jails ex-football head coach for bribery". BBC. 13 December 2024. Retrieved 13 December 2024.-
